intro: Kuhnia maximiliani, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, are arranged in dense spikes and bloom in late summer. Kuhnia maximiliani thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes, fens, and along the edges of ponds.
